text.__SUMMARY__: Conasprella armiger is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae, the cone snails and their allies.Like all species within the genus Conasprella, these snails are predatory and venomous. They are capable of "stinging" humans, therefore live ones should be handled carefully or not at all.
text.Distribution: This species occurs in the Caribbean Sea, the Gulf of Mexico and off the Lesser Antilles.
text.Description: The maximum recorded shell length is 40 mm.
text.Habitat: Minimum recorded depth is 35 m. Maximum recorded depth is 227 m.
text.References: Puillandre N., Duda T.F., Meyer C., Olivera B.M. & Bouchet P. (2015). One, four or 100 genera? A new classification of the cone snails. Journal of Molluscan Studies. 81: 1-23
